repository.orgName: Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Hamburg Carl von Ossietzky

msContents.summary:
The paper manuscript is written in Grantha script with black ink pen. It has both the mūla text and the commentary. The mūla text is indented and written at the centre of the page. The paper seems to be from year 1824 as one emblem shows. First three pages are missing. It begins with the section Vivādabhaṅgārṇava. On the last page in the left margin sticker of. ING . 320 . STA and blue stamp of East India Postage is seen.
First 3 pages are missing.

msItem.title: Dāyabhāgaṭīkā
msItem.incipit: ṭī-4-1 kti [Due to ink feeding, one syllable is unreadable.] śābhāvācca . kecittu yatreti nimittasaptamī yadarthaśca vivādapadaṃ tathā ca yadvivādanimittaṃ pitryasyārthasya ṭī-4-2 putrai vibhāgokṣapātaḥ prakalpyate . tadvivādapadandāyabhāga ityāhuḥ . ña ityarthe yatreti supāṃ supā sā[dvī?]
msItem.explicit: ṭī-201-8 ṇṣaviprovivṛtiṃ vitete .. dīpttivisadārthaṃ yaṃ prabhṛtārthaprakāśitaṃ dhīrāmodakaritā[dā?] dāyabhāgaprabodhinī
msItem.finalRubric: ṭī-201-9iti śrīkṛṣṇatarkālaṃkārabhaṭṭācāryakṛtādyabhāgaṭīkā samāptā ..[design of flower] śūbhamastu .. [design of flower]

msItem.title: Dāyabhāga
msItem.explicit:
mū 201-2 tradhīdhyāṃ minunāṃ saṃvādamātrakṛtaye kṛtīnaḥ prayatnaḥ bahuvidhavṛddhanibandhavyākhyāsaṃ
mū 201- 3 jātasaṃśayasyaitat jīmūtavāhanakṛtaṃ l̥prakararamanupattaye dhyeyaṃ .. iti pāribhadriyamahā
mū 201-4 mahopādhyāyaśrījīmūtavāhanakṛtau dharmaratne dāyabhāgassamāptaḥ .. …[design of flower] śūbhamastu .. [design of flower]

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numbers in the left margin but incontinues.

handNote.desc: Writing style is small and pointed characters.

encodingDesc.p: Space is added to separate words and unclear word is put in the square bracket with question mark.
